meanings.sent1: The immanent beauty of the flower was evident to all who passed by.
meanings.sent2: The immanent truth of the statement was hard to deny.
meanings.sent3: The immanent joy of the children playing in the park brought smiles to everyone's faces.
meanings.sent4: The immanent power of nature could be felt in the roaring of the waterfall.
meanings.sent5: The immanent danger of the storm made everyone seek shelter.

meanings.definition: Inherent; existing within something as a permanent element or quality.
meanings.sent1: The immanent sense of peace in the garden was soothing to the soul.
meanings.sent2: The immanent connection between the siblings was heartwarming to witness.
meanings.sent3: The immanent smell of freshly baked cookies filled the house with warmth and happiness.
meanings.sent4: The immanent strength of the old tree stood as a symbol of resilience.
meanings.sent5: The immanent wisdom of the elderly was a source of guidance for the community.
